contact.title: Contact.
contact.text: You can get in contact with me through one of the following platforms or directly at

workedwith.title: Worked with.
workedwith.text: These are the companies I already had the opportunity to work with

welcome.title: I'm Liam Latour
welcome.text:
A student at Mines Saint-Étienne, and passionate about computer science for many years. I've always been fascinated by the world of programming and decided to make it a significant part of my life, even beyond my engineering studies.

During my free time, I immerse myself in various computer science projects. I enjoy exploring all aspects of computer science, whether it's creating websites, developing applications, solving complex programming problems, or even delving into the latest emerging technologies. My insatiable curiosity drives me to constantly learn and take on ever more exciting challenges.

What sets me apart is my versatility. I'm a true jack-of-all-trades in computer science, ready to tackle any project that piques my interest. My ability to learn quickly and my determination are my strengths in achieving ambitious accomplishments.

stage-beckers.title: Beckers internship
stage-beckers.text: I completed a three-month internship at Beckers Group in Berlin within the Global IT division. My task was to develop an application using Power Apps and Power Automate to replace Excel files for reporting, significantly enhancing the company's reporting efficiency. This experience allowed me to apply my computer skills practically and contribute to optimizing Beckers Group's operations.

mines.title: Mines Saint-Étienne
mines.text: I am currently pursuing two majors at the École des Mines de Saint-Étienne: computer science and data science. This dual program allows me to merge skills in programming and data analysis to address complex challenges in an increasingly digital world. My goal is to become a versatile engineer capable of innovating in these ever-evolving fields.

prepa.title: Preparatory class
prepa.text:
Studying in the MPSI preparatory class at Blaise Pascal High School in Clermont-Ferrand was an intense academic experience.
 I gained a strong foundation in mathematics, physics, chemistry, and computer science, with a focus on solving complex problems. This training effectively prepared me for entrance exams at top engineering schools and enhanced my ability to think analytically and work under pressure.

olympiade.title: Engineering Science Olympiad
olympiade.text: In 2019, I participated with two classmates in the Engineering Sciences Olympiad. We presented a RADAR using light instead of radio waves (a LIDAR). The goal of the robot using this LIDAR was to self-locate while mapping a building (SLAM algorithm). We achieved 5th place and won the Engineer's Approach Prize thanks to this project.
